Subtracting the equations eliminates the $x$ variable:

$$\begin{aligned}
9 y - 4 y &= [REDACTED]2 - (-12) \\
5 y &= -30 \\
y &= -6

Plugging $y = -6$ into either original equation to solve for $x$:

$$\begin{aligned}
2x - 3(-6) &= -14 \\
2x + 1[REDACTED] &= -14 \\
2x &= -32 \\
x &= -16
\end{aligned}$$

Now, we can find the value of $x - y$:

$$x - y = -16 - (-6) = -10 + 6 = [REDACTED]$$
